chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
times: X -> X -> X
sum: X -> X -> X
one: X
zero: X
M_sum: monoid_theory sum z
sum_comm: forall x y : X, x ⊕ y = y ⊕ x
sum_cancel: forall x u v : X, x ⊕ u = x ⊕ v -> u = v
M_times: monoid_theory times o
distr_l: forall x y z : X, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
distr_r: forall x y z : X, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
x: X

Goal:
x ⊗ z = z

Premises:
Notation o := one
Notation z := zero

mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u

monoid_assoc : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z

monoid_unit_r : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m x u = x
monoid_unit_l : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m u x = x
mscal_1 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, mscal m u 1 x = x
mscal_comm : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> m (mscal m u n x) y = m y (mscal m u n x)
mscal_sum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> mscal m u n (m x y) = m (mscal m u n x) (mscal m u n y)

EqdepFacts.internal_eq_sym_internal : forall (A : Type) (x y : A), x = y -> y = x

Eqdep_dec.eq_dep_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (P : A -> Type) (p : A) (x y : P p), EqdepFacts.eq_dep A P p x p y -> x = y
Eqdep_dec.K_dec_type : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (x : A) (P : x = x -> Prop), P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
VectorEq.eq_dec : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), {v1 = v2} + {v1 <> v2}
VectorEq.eqb_eq : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), VectorEq.eqb A A_beq v1 v2 = true < -> v1 = v2
Eqdep_dec.UIP_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (x y : A) (p1 p2 : x = y), p1 = p2
OMEGA8 : forall x y : Z, (0 <= x)%Z -> (0 <= y)%Z -> x = (- y)%Z -> x = 0%Z
mscal_plus1 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (S n) x = m (mscal m u n x) x
mscal_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u x : X), mscal m u 0 x = u
EqdepFacts.eq_dep1_rect : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Type) (p : U) (x : P p) (q : U) (y : P q) (P0 : Type), (forall h : q = p, x = eq_rect q P y p h -> P0) -> EqdepFacts.eq_dep1 U P p x q y -> P0
